subject: RE: [junit] US DoD and jUnit
msgSnippet: Dear David, I haven t heard of any such restriction, which doesn t mean it doesn t exist. I m afraid I can t give you the answer you need one way or the other.
messageBody:
Dear David,

I haven't heard of any such restriction, which doesn't mean it doesn't
exist. I'm afraid I can't give you the answer you need one way or the other.
If you get a definitive answer, please let us know.

Regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
David McReynolds
Sent: Monday, December 01, 2008 11:04 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] US DoD and jUnit



Someone popped up at a meeting this morning and announced that the US
DoD does not allow the use of jUnit for unit testing. First, I find
that a little hard to swallow given the second statement about junit
being the built-in testing generator provided by java (can you say
non-sequitor?). Secondly, I cannot corroborate that statement via google.

What I need is link to a document that explicitly corroborates or
refutes the statement. So far, it looks like the statement is false
but I am only using deductive reasoning there.






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
